channel.title: Use Pluggable Transports in Whonix
channel.description:
Hello, I'm trying to use pluggable transports in whonix. My torrc file in the gateway looks like this [code]UseBridges 1 Bridge obfs3 ip:port hash[/code]
But for some reason I can never connect to the internet. Have tried other PT, same thing. Bridges only work without PTs for me.
Is there something I should know and i'm doing wrong?

item.title: Use Pluggable Transports in Whonix
item.dc:creator: RickySpartacus
item.description:
Thanks I missed ClientTransportPlugin parameter. Everything works fine now

Read full topic

item.title: Use Pluggable Transports in Whonix
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Have you seen Whonix’s documentation on bridges already?

  • https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Bridges
  • https://github.com/Whonix/anon-gw-anonymizer-config/blob/master/etc/tor/torrc.examples#L23

Also see:

  • https://www.whonix.org/wiki/About#Based_on_Debian

The question is, would what you are doing also work with system Tor’s torrc or by editing TBB’s torrc? If the answer is yet, it should work with Whonix as well. This is a trick to get access to a much bigger documentation and support community.

Read full topic

item.title: Use Pluggable Transports in Whonix
item.dc:creator: RickySpartacus
item.description:
Hello,
I’m trying to use pluggable transports in whonix.
My torrc file in the gateway looks like this

UseBridges 1 Bridge obfs3 ip:port hash

But for some reason I can never connect to the internet. Have tried other PT, same thing. Bridges only work without PTs for me.

Is there something I should know and i’m doing wrong?

Read full topic
